item.title: Run Qiskit Code Assistant Locally easily!
item.description:
Don‚Äôt have access to the Qiskit Code Assistant because you‚Äôre not on an IBM Quantum Premium plan?

No worries‚Äîyou can run it directly on your computer! We‚Äôve recently improved the local setup experience. With our scripts, you can:

  • ‚úÖ Download the LLM optimized for local enviroments (GGUF)
  • ‚úÖ Enable inference on your machine (through Ollama)
  • ‚úÖ Automatically configure the Qiskit Code Assistant VSCode or JupyterLab extension

Give it a try and share your feedback‚Äîwe‚Äôd love to hear how you use it!

More info: https://quantum.cloud.ibm.com/docs/en/guides/qiskit-code-assistant-local#quick-start-recommended

#Qiskit #QuantumComputing #AI #Ollama #OpenSource #AIforQuantum

Originally shared on LinkedIn on December 2, 2025

item.title: Qiskit Code Assistant Upgraded to Mistral-Small-3.2-24B-Qiskit
item.description:
We’ve upgraded the Qiskit Code Assistant! üöÄ

Last month, we introduced mistral-small-3.2-24b-qiskit, replacing granite-3.3-8b-qiskit.

Key Improvements

‚úÖ Better accuracy: The new model ranks higher across key benchmarks, including QiskitHumanEval, QiskitHumanEval Hard, HumanEval, MathQA, ASDiv, SciQ and others (see the model card for more info).

‚úÖ Improved UX: More precise responses for quantum programming tasks.

‚úÖ Open access: Available on Hugging Face ‚Üí https://huggingface.co/Qiskit/mistral-small-3.2-24b-qiskit.

This update is part of our mission to make quantum development more intuitive and efficient. üåü

Explore it, test it, and share your feedback!

#Qiskit #QuantumComputing #AI #OpenSource #HuggingFace

Originally shared on LinkedIn on November 27, 2025

item.title: Qiskit Code Assistant: New Open-Source LLM Models Released
item.description:
üöÄ We’re thrilled to announce the latest open-source LLM releases from the Qiskit Code Assistant team! üöÄ

These new models bring enhanced capabilities and broader compatibility to quantum computing development.

What’s New:

‚ú® Qiskit 2.0 Compatibility - Our newer models are fully compatible with Qiskit 2.0 code, ensuring seamless development with the latest quantum computing framework

üß† Enhanced Text Understanding - Significant improvements in general text comprehension and code generation capabilities

üî¨ Expanding Our Horizons - We continue to leverage the newest stable versions of IBM Granite 3.2 and 3.3 models, while for the first time exploring beyond IBM Granite with the powerful Qwen2.5-Coder series

Available Models: ‚Ä¢ Granite 3.3 8B Qiskit (+ GGUF) ‚Ä¢ Granite 3.2 8B Qiskit (+ GGUF) ‚Ä¢ Qwen2.5-Coder 14B Qiskit (+ GGUF)

All models are available on Hugging Face and ready for local deployment!

üîó Browse All Models: https://huggingface.co/Qiskit üîó Get Started: https://quantum.cloud.ibm.com/docs/en/guides/qiskit-code-assistant-local

We’d love to hear how you’re making the most of these models! Share your experiences and quantum development journey with us. üåü

Big thanks to the team involved in this release, specially to Nicolas Dupuis, Adarsh Tiwari and Ismael Faro

#QuantumComputing #OpenSource #AI #LLMs #Qiskit #IBM #TechInnovation #QuantumDevelopment #QiskitCodeAssistant

Originally shared on LinkedIn on July 8, 2025 - 304 reactions, 16 comments as of 11/12/2025

item.title: New Qiskit HumanEval Release: Qiskit 1.4 Compatibility and Benchmark Improvements
item.description:
New Qiskit HumanEval release! üöÄ

We’ve just updated https://huggingface.co/datasets/Qiskit/qiskit_humaneval to be compatible with the latest Qiskit 1.4 release! But that’s not all - our update also includes significant improvements to the benchmark, making it more robust and rigorous in terms of code execution tests to provide even more accurate and comprehensive evaluations of your LLM-generated quantum code

View the full changelog: https://github.com/qiskit-community/qiskit-human-eval/compare/0.1.0...0.1.1

Want to know more about Qiskit HumanEval? Check out our paper https://arxiv.org/abs/2406.14712

#qiskit #AIforQuantum #qiskit_humaneval

Originally shared on LinkedIn on March 14, 2025 - 26 reactions, 2 comments as of 11/12/2025

item.title: Granite-8B-Qiskit-RC-0.10: Updated Checkpoint Using Current Training Approach
item.description:
üôå Thanks to the feedback received, we’ve released a revised version of the granite-8b-qiskit-rc-0.10! Check out the improved checkpoint at https://huggingface.co/Qiskit/granite-8b-qiskit-rc-0.10

item.title: Shipping Granite-8B-Qiskit-RC-0.10: The Final Model of Current Training Era
item.description:
üöÄ Last Friday, we shipped something special: granite-8b-qiskit-rc-0.10, our latest revision of the LLMs that empower the Qiskit Code Assistant.

Trained on a significantly expanded Qiskit synthetic dataset, this release marks the end of an era - it’s our final model using the current training approach.

What’s next? We’re pivoting to newer Granite base models and starting to integrate other cutting-edge techniques. Stay tuned!

Check it out: https://huggingface.co/Qiskit/granite-8b-qiskit-rc-0.10

#Qiskit #QuantumComputing #AI #AIforQuantum #QiskitCodeAssistant

Originally shared on LinkedIn on February 18, 2025 - 126 reactions, 8 comments as of 11/12/2025

item.title: qiskit-ibm-transpiler Ranks #4 in Unitary Fund 2024 Survey
item.description:
üéâ Exciting news! The qiskit-ibm-transpiler has been recognized as the “4th most used quantum computing development tool globally” in the 2024 Unitary Fund survey under the “Full-stack development platforms, compilers, and simulators” category.

What makes this particularly remarkable? The project has only been publicly available for just over a year!

üîç What is the qiskit-ibm-transpiler?

It’s a library that combines Qiskit’s powerful heuristic algorithms with our cutting-edge AI transpiler passes. Think of it as a sophisticated translator that optimizes your quantum code to run more efficiently on real quantum hardware.

üåç What this means:

This recognition reflects both the growing adoption of quantum computing and the community’s trust in AI-powered tools. It’s an acknowledgment of not just our technology, but of every developer who has contributed to and embraced this project.

üîó Resources:

  • GitHub: https://github.com/Qiskit/qiskit-ibm-transpiler
  • Documentation: https://docs.quantum.ibm.com/transpile/qiskit-ibm-transpiler

Thank you to everyone who has been part of this journey. Here’s to pushing the boundaries of quantum computing together! üöÄ

#QuantumComputing #OpenSource #Qiskit #IBM #SoftwareDevelopment #AITranspilerPasses #QiskitIBMTranspiler #AIforQuantum

Originally shared on LinkedIn on December 17, 2024 - 79 reactions, 1 comment as of 11/12/2025
